data.text: New York: Simon and Schuster, 1931. Hardcover. xxvi, 430 p., frontispiece and 9 leaves of illustrations; 24 cm. With separately printed index, paginated 431-441. Red cloth with gilt-stamped spine title and blind-stamped cover title. Without dust jacket. The author died shortly after he completed the book. "The proof sheets were corrected for the press by Mr. George Bernard Shaw himself." With several newspaper clippings relating to Shaw, including a review of the book by Archibald Henderson, the "official biographer" of Shaw, and responses to that review. In Very Good Condition: spine is slightly faded; white soiling along fore-edge of front board; back board slightly scraped; shadow on front fixed endpaper and front of cover of index from the newspaper clippings; otherwise, clean and tight. Very Good. Item #004575
